defs: = ತಿರುಗುಳಿ.
a turning or rotating (a thing, another person, etc.) horizontally, parallel to the ground.
= ತಿರುಪಾಡು.
= ತಿರುಪಾಡು.
= ತಿರುಪಾಡು.
a Tamil hymn or song in praise of a deity, esp. Śiva.
to turn or twist (something usu. on its axis); to cause to rotate.
to cause to wander.
to turn (something) to face another side; to make upside down.
to turn or coil (string, ribbon, etc.) around itself to form a ball or around something else so as to encircle it closely; to twine; to wind.
to turn back; to withdraw (oneself, as from facing a danger, battle, etc.).
to stir (as something being cooked) with or as with a ladle as to mix thoroughly.
to cause to wear, put on (as an ornament).
to crush into fine particles in a mortar by grinding.
the act of turning or twisting (oneself).
(mus.) a particular type of regulated movement from one note to another.
the act of making another wander, roam about.
(dance.) circular movement.
a cover, lid that is threaded like a screw that can be tightened by turning in one direction and loosened by turning in another.
the point or region where something is bent; a turn.
a moving or going in a different (usu. unexpected) direction.
a roaming around; wandering.
the tree Hopea parviflora of Dipterocarpaceae family; iron wood of Malabar.
to turn one's body (as in dancing).
a spiral staircase, usu. having a handrail or balustrade.
a kind of ornament fixed to the braided hair with the help of a screw.
= ತಿರುಗುಳಿ.
the act or fact of wandering, roaming.
a begging for food, help, etc.
food or grains got as alms; ತಿರುಪೆ ಎತ್ತು tirupe ettu to ask for alms; to beg.
a man who begs or asks for charity, esp. one who lives by begging; a beggar.
a woman who begs or asks for charity, esp. one who lives by begging; a beggar.
= ತಿರುಪಣಿ2.
any verse in the devotional, literary work byānḍāḷin Tamil.
a devotional, poetic composition in Tamil in praise of Viṣṇu.
a counter-shouting against a person to snub down.
a beggar's bowl.
a beggar.
a poor, destitute person.
a sacred hymn.
(fig.) a plan, scheme or action to counter another's; ಗುರುವಿಗೇ ತಿರುಮಂತ್ರ ಹೇಳು guruvigē tiru mantra hēḷu to counter, usu. disobediently, one's preceptor, elder, etc.
= ತಿರುಮಣ್ಣು.
= ತಿರುಮಣ್ಣು.
a kind of white powder used to put a vertical sectarian mark on the forehead.
a hill (or a range of seven hills) in Andhra Pradesh, in South India, famous centre for Hindu pilgrims; Tirupati hills.
a garland of flowers meant for a deity.
a garland put on a deity or a piece of it given to a devotee.
a series of buildings along side of the compound wall of a temple.
a room in a house where the idols of deities are kept for regular worship.
a house of a respectable person.
the moustache the either end of which is twisted upward.
consciousness - a) the state of being conscious; awareness of one's own feelings, what is happening around one, etc.
the totality of one's thoughts, feelings, and impressions; conscious mind.
a tuft of long hair at the back of the head, left unshaven for religious purpose.

a person whose body is considered sacred.

ceremonial rites for averting the evil eye at the close of daily worship or festival in a temple.
sacred feet (of a deity, saint, sage, etc.).
a sage or saint.
a festival observed in the Dhanu month (the ninth month of solar calendar year corresponding to December-January) in a Śiva temple.
a reading or reciting of sacred literary works.
boiled rice offered to an idol.
a small piece of cloth for dressing an idol of a deity.
a kind of plant .
a play depicting the sacred sports of a deity.
the central point of the string of a bow.

to set a bow on a bow (to be shot).

a returning (something received earlier) or responding to another's action.

to pull the string of a bow (to produce a heavy sound).
memorisation of a passage by reading it repeatedly.

removed or withdrawn from sight; concealed; hidden; covered; disappeared.

to make (things) tidy; to tidy up.
to make ready; to prepare.
to guide (another) to improve knowledge, ability, skill, etc.
to become apt, correct or favourable.
to foretell something good or favourable.
to settle a quarrel or dispute; to reconcile conflicting parties.
to be warded off; to be prevented from happening.
to cause to flow in or as in a stream.
to break and turn up or remove (ground, etc.) with a spade or other tool or with hands, claws, etc.

to delineate something in or paint, a picture.

to read and mark corrections on (printers' proofs, etc.); to correct one's or another's writing.
to cut or incise letters, designs, etc. in or on (a surface); to engrave.
to repay completely a loan.
to come to an end.
to lessen (another's) burden, unbearable responsibility, etc.
to allay or relieve (pain, an ache, etc.); to assuage; to soothe.
to distribute; to disperse.
a piece of land higher than its adjacent land; a natural elevation of land.
the raising ground on either side of a river, around a lake, pond or adjoining an ocean; shore or bank.
a group of things placed, thrown or lying one on another; a heap.
a raised platform.
a raised seat.
the top portion or section of anything.
(the feeling of itching ) to be felt.

to move forward by or as by crawling.
to exert oneself vigorously; to work hard; to struggle.
(in marble game) to push the marble with one's knuckle.
to take out grass, weeds, etc. by loosening the soil with a hoe or spade.
the plant Tridax procumbense of Asteraceae family.
having a sharp edge or point; that can cut well; sharp; keen; fine edged; incisive.
having or giving off heat; having a high temperature; hot.
severe - a) harsh; unnecessarily extreme; b) serious or stern in manner or appearance; c) grave; critical.
sharply affecting the organs of taste or smell, as if by a penetrating power; biting; acrid; pungent.
vigorous; energetic; intense.
feeling or showing keen desire; impatient or anxious to do or get; ardent; eager.

an instrument or device of any kind used to injure or kill; a weapon.
a substance with an inherent property that tends to destroy life or impair health; poison.
iron or steal.

its slender, long edible fruit, used as a vegetable.
to make sharp or sharper; to sharpen; to hone; to whet.
to make intense or more intense; to increase; to aggravate; to intensify.
the quality of being sharp, keen; sharpness.
the quality of having a high temperature; hotness.
strictness; harshness; severity.
the quality of being intense - a) extreme degree of anything; b) great energy or vehemence of emotion, thought, motion or activity.
the quality or fact of being sharp and quick in seeing; a keen vision; the probing attitude.
the sharp blade of a weapon as a sword.

quick, acute or penetrating intellect; acute cleverness; shrewdness.
a person having sharp intelligence.
the sun, whose rays of light are hot.
the digestive faculty, esp. the bile that helps in digestion.
a piercing look from the corner of an eye that affects sharply the feelings of another.
the act of making (something) sharp or sharper.
